results.title: Variability in response to albuminuria-lowering drugs: true or random?
results.text_hl: Additionally, the @<m>DISEASE_Albuminuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@ responses strongly correlated when the same individual was re-exposed to the same drug at the same dose: @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ 10 mg day-1 (R2  = 53%; P < 0.01), @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ 50 mg day-1 (R2  = 63%; P < 0.01).

citations.NLM: Petrykiv SI, de Zeeuw D, Persson F, Rossing P, Gansevoort RT, Laverman GD, Heerspink HJL. Variability in response to albuminuria-lowering drugs: true or random? Br J Clin Pharmacol. 2017 Jun;83(6):1197-1204. PMID: 28002889
citations.BibTeX: @article{28002889, title={Variability in response to albuminuria-lowering drugs: true or random?}, author={Petrykiv SI and de Zeeuw D and Persson F and Rossing P and Gansevoort RT and Laverman GD and Heerspink HJL}, journal={Br J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={83}, number={6}, pages={1197-1204}}

results.title: Differences between nisoldipine and lisinopril on glomerular filtration rates and albuminuria in hypertensive IDDM patients with diabetic nephropathy during the first year of treatment.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Albuminuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@Albuminuria@@@ was reduced 47% (95% CI 21-65) in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ group versus an increase of 11% (-3 to 27) in the @CHEMICAL_Nisoldipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015737 @@@nisoldipine@@@ group (P = 0.001).

citations.NLM: Rossing P, Tarnow L, Boelskifte S, Jensen BR, Nielsen FS, Parving HH. Differences between nisoldipine and lisinopril on glomerular filtration rates and albuminuria in hypertensive IDDM patients with diabetic nephropathy during the first year of treatment. Diabetes. 1997 Mar;46(3):481-7. PMID: 9032106

results.title: Long-term renoprotective effect of nisoldipine and lisinopril in type 1 diabetic patients with diabetic nephropathy.
results.text_hl: Whereas initiation of treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ resulted in a reduction from baseline @<m>DISEASE_Albuminuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@ by 52% (95% CI 14-73), @<m>DISEASE_Albuminuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@ in the @CHEMICAL_Nisoldipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015737 @@@nisoldipine@@@ group did not change throughout the study GFR declined in a biphasic manner with an initial (0-6 months) reduction of 1.3 +/- 0.3 ml x min(-1) x month(-1) in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ group compared with 0.2 +/- 0.4 ml x min(-1) x month(-1) in the @CHEMICAL_Nisoldipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015737 @@@nisoldipine@@@ group (P < 0.01).

citations.NLM: Tarnow L, Rossing P, Jensen C, Hansen BV, Parving HH. Long-term renoprotective effect of nisoldipine and lisinopril in type 1 diabetic patients with diabetic nephropathy. Diabetes Care. 2000 Dec;23(12):1725-30. PMID: 11128341
citations.BibTeX: @article{11128341, title={Long-term renoprotective effect of nisoldipine and lisinopril in type 1 diabetic patients with diabetic nephropathy.}, author={Tarnow L and Rossing P and Jensen C and Hansen BV and Parving HH}, journal={Diabetes Care}, volume={23}, number={12}, pages={1725-30}}
